content:
Rakuten is a great way to earn cash back on your online purchases!

I'm glad you're interested in using a spreadsheet to track your spending. I can definitely provide you with some templates and examples to get you started.

Here's a simple holiday shopping budget tracker template you can use:

**Holiday Shopping Budget Tracker Template**

| **Category** | **Budget** | **Spent** | **Remaining** | **Notes** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Family Gifts | $100 | $50 | $50 |  |
| Friend Gifts | $50 | $20 | $30 |  |
| Coworker Gifts | $20 | $10 | $10 |  |
| Decorations | $50 | $30 | $20 |  |
| ... | ... | ... | ... | ... |

You can add or remove categories as needed, and update the budget and spent columns as you make purchases.

Here's another template that allows you to track individual gifts and prices:

**Holiday Gift Tracker Template**

| **Recipient** | **Gift** | **Price** | **Purchased** | **Notes** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mom | Scarf | $20 | |  |
| Brother | Gaming Console | $100 | |  |
| Coworker | Coffee Mug | $10 | |  |
| ... | ... | ... | ... | ... |

You can use this template to track individual gifts, prices, and whether you've purchased them or not.

Feel free to customize these templates to fit your needs, or combine them to create a hybrid template that works for you.

If you're not comfortable creating your own spreadsheet from scratch, you can also search for "holiday budget templates" or "holiday shopping trackers" online, and find many free templates available for download.

Do either of these templates work for you, or would you like me to suggest any modifications or additions?
